sen.j: 橘（たちばな）氏は、古代日本に活躍した氏族。
sen.e: The Tachibana clan was a family (clan), which had an important influence in the ancient Japan.
The Tachibana clan was a family (clan), which took an active role in ancient Japan.
sen.cmt: had an important influence→took an active role と修正しました。the を削除しました。
sen.e: The Tachibana clan was a family (clan), which took an active role in ancient Japan.

sen.j: 和銅元年（708年）、県犬養三千代が元明天皇から橘宿禰（たちばなのすくね）の氏姓を賜ったことを淵源とする。
sen.e: The clan's origin dated back to 708, when Agata no INUKAI no Michiyo was granted Shisei (clan and hereditary title) of TACHIBANA no Sukune by Emperor Genmei.

sen.j: その子、葛城王が橘諸兄へ改名した後、諸兄の子孫は橘氏を称した。
sen.e: Since the time when Sukune's son, Katsuragi no okimi (Prince Katsuragi) changed his name to TACHIBANA no Moroe, his descendents called themselves the Tachibana clan.

sen.j: 諸兄は、はじめ橘宿禰の姓を受け、その後、橘朝臣の姓を賜与された。
sen.e: Moroe, firstly received sei (the surname), TACHIBANA no Sukune, and afterwards, he was given the sei (surname), Tachibana no Ason.

sen.j: 平安時代に入ると、橘氏の多くは橘朝臣を称した。
sen.e: In the Heian Period, many of the members of the Tachibana clan used the name of TACHIBANA no Ason.
In the Heian period, many of the Tachibana clan members used the name of TACHIBANA no Ason.

sen.j: いわゆる四姓、本姓の一つであり、平安時代中期まで代々公卿を輩出したが、その後は橘氏公卿が絶え、以後振るわなかった。
sen.e: It is one of the so called 'Shisei,' or four honseis (principle authentic surnames), and the clan had produced many Kugyo (high court nobles) during generations until the mid-Heian Period, however, after that, the Tachibana clan discontinued to hold the position of Kugyo, and since then, the clan had lost its influence.

sen.j: 橘氏の実質上の祖は県犬養三千代とされている。
sen.e: The real ancestor of the Tachibana clan is said to have been Agata no INUKAI no Michiyo.

sen.j: 三千代は天武天皇朝から命婦として仕え、文武天皇の乳母をつとめたともされ、後宮の実力者として皇室と深い関係にあった。
sen.e: Michiyo served as Myobu (a high-ranking court lady) since the Emperor Tenmu's era and is also said to have been Emperor Monmu's menoto (a woman providing breast-feed to a highborn baby), having an intimate relationship with the Imperial family as an influential person in the kokyu (empress's residence).

sen.j: 三千代ははじめ美努王の妻となり、橘諸兄や橘佐為を生んだ。

sen.j: 694年に美努王が大宰帥として九州へ赴任すると、代わって藤原不比等の夫人となり、藤原光明子（光明皇后）らを生んだ。
sen.e: In 695, when Minu no Okimi went to Kyushu as dazai no sochi (the chief of Dazaifu [Government Headquarters in Kyushu]), she then became the lawful wife of FUJIWARA no Fuhito, and FUJIWARA no Komyoshi (Empress Komyo) was born.

sen.j: 和銅元年11月25日、元明天皇の大嘗祭に際して、天武天皇治世期から永く仕えてきた三千代の功績が称えられ、橘の浮かんだ杯とともに橘宿禰の氏姓が賜与された。
sen.e: On January 14, 709 (表記の変更), when Daijosai (the first ceremonial offering of the rice) by newly-enthroned Emperor Genmei was held, Michiyo was given Shisei (clan and hereditary title) of TACHIBANA no Sukune, together with a cup in which a flower of mandarin orange was floating on sake, for her long contribution since the Emperor Tenmu's era.

sen.j: 三千代が天平5年（733年）に没すると、同8年11月11日に三千代の子の橘諸兄と橘佐為が橘宿禰の氏姓継承を朝廷へ申請し、同月17日に許された。

sen.j: 橘諸兄は橘諸兄へ改名し、佐為王は橘佐為を称した。
sen.e: Then, TACHIBANA no Moroe changed his former name to TACHIBANA no Moroe, and Sai no Okimi changed his name to TACHIBANA no Sai, respectively.
Then, TACHIBANA no Moroe changed his former name to TACHIBANA no Moroe, and Sai no Okimi changed his name to TACHIBANA no Sai, respectively.

sen.j: 諸兄は既に天平3年から参議に就いて議政官（公卿）を勤めていたが、天平9年には大納言へのぼると、翌10年には右大臣へ、同15年には左大臣へ昇進し、聖武天皇・孝謙天皇両天皇の治世期に太政官首班として政治に当たった。
sen.e: Moroe, who had already began serving as Giseikan (Legislature) (Kugyo)assuming the post of Sangi (councilor), ascended to Dainagon (major councilor) in 737, and Udaijin (Minister of the Right) in 734 (表記の変更), and in 743 (表記の変更) he finally reached Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) and dedicated himself to national politics as the premier of Daijokan (Grand Council of State) during the eras of Emperor Shomu and Emperor Koken.

sen.j: 諸兄が天平勝宝9歳正月に薨去すると、その子橘奈良麻呂は、藤原仲麻呂との政権争いに敗れ、同年7月に謀叛の疑いをかけられ獄死した（橘奈良麻呂の乱）。
sen.e: After Moroe died on New Year's Day of the 9th year of Tenpyo-shoho era (757), his son TACHIBANA no Naramaro lost in the power struggle with FUJIWARA no Nakamaro, and died in prison in July 757 (表記の変更) on the suspicion of conspiring a rebellion (Revolt of TACHIBANA no Naramaro).

sen.j: その後、しばらく橘氏が議政官（公卿）に名を連ねることはなかったが、奈良麻呂孫の橘嘉智子（檀林皇后）が嵯峨天皇皇后となると、状況は一変した。
sen.e: Since them, the name of the Tachibana clan was not enlisted as Giseikan (Kugyo) for a while, but when Naramaro's granddaughter, TACHIBANA no Kachiko (Empress Danrin) was ascended to the Empress of Emperor Saga, the situation had changed drastically.

sen.j: 弘仁13年（822年）に橘常主（奈良麻呂孫）が約70年ぶりの橘氏公卿となり、さらに嘉智子出生の皇子が仁明天皇として即位すると、嘉智子の兄橘氏公が外戚として目覚ましい昇進をとげ、承和 (日本)11年（844年）には右大臣に至った。
